SEARCH
Package io.github.lycoriscafe.nexus.http.engine

Class RequestConsumer

java.lang.Object
io.github.lycoriscafe.nexus.http.engine.RequestConsumer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public final class RequestConsumer extends Object implements Runnable
Base of the server. The basic request receiving and response sending operations are done by this class. Every receiving connection will have an instance of this class. Also, instance of this class will be able to handle Long.MAX_VALUE - 1 times of requests in keep-alive connection. Connection related settings can be found at HttpServerConfiguration.
Since:
v1.0.0
See Also:
  • HttpServerConfiguration
  • Long.MAX_VALUE

    • readLine

      public String readLine() throws IOException
      Method to read character stream with direct socket input stream. The point is efficient and speed reading of bytes and convert into string. The line terminator always will \r\n.
      Returns:
      String, read using socket input stream and converted (charset UTF-8)
      Throws:
      IOException - Error while reading data from socket input stream
      Since:
      v1.0.0
      See Also:
      • RequestConsumer

    • dropConnection

      public void dropConnection(long requestId, HttpStatusCode httpStatusCode, String errorMessage)
      Prepare HTTP request to drop the connection. This method is used to error reporting in-API exception occurred. The errorMessage settings can be found in HttpServerConfiguration.
      Parameters:
      requestId - Request id bound to the request that throws an exception
      httpStatusCode - HTTP status code
      errorMessage - Detailed error message
      Since:
      v1.0.0
      See Also:
      • HttpServerConfiguration.setAddErrorMessageToResponseHeaders(boolean)
      • RequestConsumer

    • send

      public void send(HttpResponse httpResponse)
      Base response writer method. Response headers are write to the socket output stream by this method, but content related write operations are handled by the Content class. This method is constructed to support HTTP Pipelining.
      Parameters:
      httpResponse - HttpResponse that should be sent
      Since:
      v1.0.0
      See Also:
      • Content.WriteOperations.writeContent(RequestConsumer, Content)
      • RequestConsumer
